00043 {
00044   // Encode the flash ADC data by 
00045   // 1. Splitting the four channels.
00046   // 2. Taking successive differences between samples within a channel.
00047   // 3. Run-length encoding the differences.
00048   // 4. Huffman coding the results.
00049

00056

00058       diffs[i] = ((int) input[i].channel[chan]) - prev_sample;
00059       prev_sample = input[i].channel[chan];
00060     }
00061 
00062     for (int i = 0; i < num_fadc_samples; i++) {
00063 
00064       if (diffs[i] == 0) {
00065         // count the run length
00066         int run_length = 0;
00067         while (i + run_length < num_fadc_samples && run_length < 31) {
00068           if (diffs[i + run_length] == 0) {
00069             run_length++;
00070           } else {
00071             break;
00072           }
00073         }
00074 
00075         i += run_length - 1;
00076 
00077         io_buffer_put(output, 0, 1);
00078         huffman_put_symbol(&fadc_run_huffman, output, run_length);
00079       } else if (diffs[i] <= 4 && diffs[i] >= -4) {
00080         io_buffer_put(output, 2, 2);
00081         huffman_put_symbol(&fadc_small_huffman, output, diffs[i] + 4);
00082       } else {
00083         io_buffer_put(output, 3, 2);
00084         io_buffer_put(output, diffs[i] + 256, 9);
00085       }
00086     }
